description: Lenart Kova discreetly applies a radical transparency patch to the BCI, forcing all privileged Council logs, meetings, and communications into live public access. He leaves an encrypted note justifying the exposure as necessary for true accountability.

BCI records and Council meeting streams become accessible citywide. Residents react with shock as past abuses and privilege exceptions are revealed, fueling heated public debate and calls for resignations.
Residents form online collectives to scrutinize every new release. Public accusations against officials and citizens surge, triggering waves of social shaming and formal complaints.
Widespread mistrust takes root. Fearing exposure, people increase self-censorship and report neighbors. Social activities shrink, and city life grows tense and suspicious.
Council members begin resigning en masse under relentless scrutiny. Governance stalls and unrest simmers as transparency immobilizes leadership and deepens divides across Stenograd.
